We demonstrate **ObservableJS** interactions in a quarto document.

```{ojs}
// create a button that fires an alert
import {html} from "@observablehq/htl";

html`<button onclick="alert('Button clicked!')">Fire me!</button>`
```

```{ojs}
// Interactive capture of ref
viewof ref =  Inputs.text({label: "ref", placeholder: "Enter your ref", value: "ps1:10"})

// ref is a reactive value whereever reused
ref.length;

// craft url as a reactive value too
url =  '"' +"https://jsfapi.netlify.app/.netlify/functions/bgw?param=" +ref +'"';
ifram = "html`" +"<iframe src=" +url +"></iframe>`";
md`_${url}_ is dynamic`

html`<iframe src="https://jsfapi.netlify.app/.netlify/functions/bgw?param=gen1:1!SG21" title="jsfapi iframe static" width="400" height="300">
</iframe>`
```
